intro: Croton elkerensis, commonly known as the African croton, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often colorful, leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in spikes, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
